TEXT: The CARDINAL applicants are NORP nationals who live in the “ GPE ” ( “ GPE ” ) . The first applicant , PERSON , is the mother of the second , third and fourth applicants , Mr PERSON , PERSON and Mr PERSON . The fifth applicant , Mr PERSON , is the brother - in - law of the first applicant . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively . The first CARDINAL applicants have lodged the application on their own behalf and on behalf of Mr PERSON , the husband of the first applicant and the father of the second , third and fourth applicant . The fifth applicant has lodged the application on his own behalf and on behalf of his brothers , Mr PERSON and PERSON . The applicants were represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON and PERSON , lawyers practising in the GPE .
The complaints raised in the present application concern events that took place during the second round of military operations by GPE in northern GPE in DATE .
Before the events of DATE , the applicants , Mr PERSON and PERSON lived in PERSON , in the district of GPE .

On DATE , the NORP quarter of PERSON was under heavy fire from units of ORG . ORG advised NORP - NORP residents , through loudspeakers , to remain in their houses and the PERSON family , including the applicants and PERSON and PERSON , gathered in the house of PERSON . At the time , the second , third and fourth applicants were children aged DATE respectively , PERSON was DATE and PERSON was DATE . Everyone in the house was in civilian clothes and unarmed . While they were in the house , members of the NORP - Cypriot forces fired at the door with automatic weapons . They subsequently kicked the door open while continuing to fire , shooting and wounding PERSON , who was close to the door . PERSON then entered from the adjacent room with his hands on his head pleading with the assailants not to shoot as there were women and children among them . He was taken outside and shot with an automatic weapon . He died immediately . The dead and wounded were taken outside while the women and children were kicked , humiliated , abused and struck with rifle butts before being pushed out of the house . PERSON , who was still alive at the time not having received fatal wounds , was taken away by the NORP - Cypriot forces , together with the dead body of PERSON .

All the remaining NORP Cypriots were taken from their houses to the football pitch in town . There they were divided into groups . A number of them , including the fifth applicant , were sent to a prisoners ' camp and the rest were sent back to their homes . The fifth applicant was detained in the prisoners ' camp for DATE .

On DATE , DATE after the killings , the dead bodies of GPE and PERSON were returned to their relatives by ORG . They were taken by their relatives to the courtyard of the local mosque for burial . PERSON jaw and ribs were broken and he had pinholes in his body .

ORG of the town , PERSON , identified by name QUANTITY persons he alleged were responsible for the crimes committed on DATE . According to the applicants , the NORP - Cypriot authorities also knew the identities of the persons concerned and the NORP - Cypriot President at the time announced that those responsible would be punished .

In DATE , the second applicant visited the tombs of his father and uncle in the NORP part of the island . He was approached by a NORP - Cypriot who informed him of the names of CARDINAL people responsible for their deaths ; all CARDINAL were among those previously accused by PERSON of the killings . The second applicant was also told that the massacre had been ordered by a NORP military chief commandant .

By letter dated DATE the applicants ' lawyer requested the Attorney - General of GPE to inform him , by DATE , whether the authorities had carried out any investigation into the killings of Mr PERSON and PERSON ; the result of any such an investigation ; and whether the persons involved in the commission of the crimes had been brought to justice .

By letter dated DATE the Attorney - General informed the applicants ' lawyer that the contents of his letter of DATE was under consideration and that he would contact him in due course . No further correspondence from the Attorney - General has been received by the applicants ' lawyer .
